title: The benefits of Diwali legiyam
text:
Diwali is all about excess – and food is no exception to this! If you’d like to binge on sugary treats and deep-fried snacks, there’s also a way to counter this. For decades now, a tradition of Tamilian households has been to use Diwali legiyam or Diwali marundhu (which literally translates into medicine), to nullify the ill-effects of gluttony. It can be prepared in advance, with a spoonful eaten each day, a week prior to and after the festivities. The traditional herbs used to get the digestive fires going, and allow your tummy to settle down. However, don’t have an excess of legiyam itself – despite its herbal ingredients, it is strong! Also, it is not recommended for children below five years of age. Use only a spotlessly clean airtight container to store it.



Ingredients: (yields 1½ cup approximately)

2 ½ tbsp coriander seeds

2 ½ tbsp ajwain

2 tbsp cumin seeds

2 tbsp black pepper

¼ tsp dry ginger powder

¾ cup jaggery

3-4 tbsp ghee

1-2 tsp sesame oil





Method:

· Soak the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, ajwain and black pepper in warm water for three hours.

· Then grind this into a fine smooth paste. Use the water used for soaking, for the grinding process as well.

· Add dry ginger powder to this.

· Measure the paste in a measuring cup. For 1 cup, the measurement of jaggery needed is 3/4 cup.

· Melt the jaggery in a pan by adding ¼ cup of water. When it dissolves, filter it to get rid of the impurities.

· Boil it for 2 minutes.

· Add the ground paste to this and mix well.

· Saute it on a low flame for 15 minutes till it reaches halwa consistency. Add ghee in small intervals.

· When it is completely cool, store it in a clean dry box and keep it in the refrigerator.

· Always use a clean dry spoon to take it.
